newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal may not reach 1997 foreign debt ceiling.
newsitem.headline: Portugal may not reach 1997 foreign debt ceiling.

text.p: Portugal may not issue the full 350 billion escudos net of foreign-currency denominated debt permitted in the 1997 budget, the state's debt manager said.
Vitor Bento, chairman of the Institute for Public Credit Management (IGCP), told Reuters in an interview that there were sound macro-economic reasons for favouring the issue of domestic debt.
He noted the differential in costs of borrowing -- between the foreign and domestic markets -- had narrowed significantly.
"At the moment, it is probable that (the limit) for foreign debt will not be reached," he said.
Net foreign debt issues in 1996 totalled 320 billion escudos.
He noted that Portugal's foreign exchange reserves were "comfortable" and that there was no problem with the balance of payments. --Sergio Goncalves, Lisbon bureau 3511-3150035
